question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

The contamination must specifically relate to metal substances present in the food items. If no such withdrawal takes place within the designated period, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Pennsylvania regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For an affirmative answer, the following conditions must be fulfilled:

1. The public vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The main emphasis of the public vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed through official state channels or reputable news outlets.

If such a public vote, meeting these stipulations, does not take place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered negatively. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a public vote without actually carrying it out by the specified deadline does not satisfy the criteria for an affirmative answer.

Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body:

4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

question.title: Will California hold a referendum on gun control measures by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) is spreading election misinformation. Completion must not be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state? For a positive resolution:

The question will resolve as NO if:

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will the UK economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy has not slipped into a recession. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as indicated by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The inquiry will be deemed negative if the UK economy undergoes two successive quarters of declining GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if General Motors reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

If no such legislation is enacted by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if legislation is enacted but does not fulfill all the aforementioned criteria, the response will be NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the Italian economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy has not entered a recession. For this question, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The answer will be NO if the Italian economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: Will there be a monthly rise in the Federal Reserve's favored inflation metric that surpasses 0.5% by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Federal Reserve's favored inflation metric (usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any single month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially reported by the Federal Reserve or a pertinent U.S. government body (like the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such rise is documented during this timeframe, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any other duration.

question.title: Given the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024, will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
This question examines the potential impact of inflation in the United States on the Italian economy. 

Suppose the following is true: The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources. 

Then, will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 31, 2024? 

For the purpose of this question, the Italian economy avoids a recession if it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The question resolves as YES if the Italian economy avoids such a recession, and NO if it does not.

para_P.title: If the Federal Reserve's main inflation indicator indicates a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% by July 2024, will Italy's economy steer clear of a recession by that time?
para_P.body:

Assuming the following holds true: The Federal Reserve's primary inflation indicator (usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) shows a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially announced by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. governmental body and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets. 

Then, will Italy's economy avoid entering a recession by July 31, 2024? 

In this context, the Italian economy is considered to have avoided a recession if it does not undergo two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth, as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics, anytime between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The outcome is YES if the Italian economy successfully avoids such a recession, and NO if it does not.

question.body:

question.body:

6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

Assuming the following holds true: Shopify officially announces a reduction of at least 1,800 jobs by July 31, 2024, as part of its reorganization plan focused on AI. This announcement must be validated through official company statements, regulatory disclosures, or reports from at least two credible news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal), and the layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan introduced in 2023.

Then, will the S&P 500 index attain or exceed 4,800 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024? The 4,800 point mark is selected as a significant threshold that the index may have reached prior to a major decline. Confirmation will rely on official index data from respected financial market information providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. Keep in mind that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index is not required to close at or above 4,800 points.

question.title: Conditional on Shopify laying off fewer than 1,800 employees by July 2024, will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question examines the potential impact of Shopify's employment decisions on the broader market. Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Shopify confirms fewer than 1,800 employees laid off as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, or no confirmation meeting the criteria is made by the resolution date, with confirmation coming from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by reputable news sources such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. Then, will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024? Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points. If the index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If Shopify has fewer than 1,800 employees laid off by July 2024, will the S&P 500 index hit or surpass 4,800 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry explores how Shopify's workforce reductions might influence the overall market. Assume the following holds true: By July 31, 2024, Shopify announces that it has laid off fewer than 1,800 employees as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI, or there is no announcement that meets this criterion by the resolution date, with confirmations coming from official company statements, regulatory documents, or credible news outlets such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan introduced in 2023. In that case, will the S&P 500 index achieve or go beyond 4,800 points at any time from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024? The assessment will rely on official index data from trustworthy financial market information sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. Intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index does not have to finish at or above 4,800 points. If the index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points during this timeframe, the answer will be YES; otherwise, it will be NO.

question.title: Will France appoint a new President by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a new President be chosen in France before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, an individual is officially designated as the new President of France. The confirmation of this appointment must come from official government communications or be reported by a minimum of two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purposes of this inquiry, a 'new' President refers to someone who is not currently in this position as of October 1, 2023. If there is no new President selected by the resolution date, or if the existing President as of October 1, 2023, continues in their role, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will the Bank of England's base rate remain at or above 5.00% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England's base rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 5.00% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the base rate set by the Bank of England stay at or exceed 5.00% in August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at any time during August 2024, the Bank of England's base rate is documented to be at or above 5.00%. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Bank of England or from at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Guardian). Conversely, if the rate is reported to drop below 5.00% and stays under this threshold for the entirety of August 2024, the resolution will be NO.

This question combines two separate conditions. 

Condition: The Bank of England's base rate must be reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Outcome: Resolves YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If the Bank of England's base rate falls below 5.00% during August 2024, will there be a new President in France by the end of that month?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds true: The Bank of England's base rate dips below 5.00% at any moment in August 2024 and stays below this threshold for the entire month, as verified by official announcements from the Bank of England or by at least two credible financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Guardian).

question.title: Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will MDMA receive FDA endorsement as a treatment for PTSD before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) grants official endorsement for MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) as a treatment for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive determination, this endorsement must be validated through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by no fewer than two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The endorsement must be specifically for the application of MDMA in the treatment of PTSD, excluding any other conditions or uses. Should no endorsement be provided by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly denies or postpones the endorsement past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be an official announcement from Mexican officials regarding the disbandment of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, on or before July 31, 2024, Mexican officials (including federal law enforcement bodies or senior government figures) release a public statement confirming that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. This announcement must be covered by a minimum of two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or prominent Mexican media outlets). The statement should reflect a substantial disruption in the cartel's leadership, operations, or its capacity to operate as a unified criminal group. Simple arrests of individual members or minor interruptions in the cartel's activities will not suffice for a YES decision. If no such official announcement that meets these conditions is made by July 31, 2024, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Conditional on Mexican authorities not officially declaring the dismantling of La Familia Michoacana by July 2024, will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?

Then, is it true that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) will officially approve MDMA for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024? For this to be true, the approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources, specifically for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD.

para_P.title: If Mexican officials do not make an official announcement regarding the disbandment of La Familia Michoacana by July 2024, will the FDA sanction MDMA as a treatment for PTSD by August 2024?

This indicates that there is no formal public statement from Mexican officials declaring that the cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal entity, as evidenced by the lack of such reports in at least two credible international news organizations. Simple arrests of individual members or partial disruptions do not suffice.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) will officially authorize MDMA for use as a treatment for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024? For this statement to be valid, the approval must be verified through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news outlets, specifically regarding the application of MDMA in treating PTSD.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Philippine authorities implement a closure of online trading platforms operated by Chinese entities by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered in the affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, there are verified reports indicating that the Philippine authorities have effectively carried out a closure of online trading platforms run by Chinese entities within the Philippines. Such enforcement must be documented by at least two credible international news outlets (for example, Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and should involve formal government actions that lead to the termination of operations for a considerable number of these trading platforms. Here, 'considerable' refers to at least 50% of the identified Chinese-operated online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of the enforcement. The closure must stem from a government policy or directive, rather than voluntary shutdowns or economic circumstances. If no enforcement that meets these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered in the negative.

question.title: Will the International Monetary Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is the International Monetary Fund expected to declare new funding commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024?

The declaration(s) must be communicated through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and covered by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments should represent new initiatives or substantial expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously announced commitments. If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments falls short of $400 million, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is California set to hold a public vote regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by the end of August 2024, California carries out a public vote aimed specifically at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The public vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of California.
2. The main objective of the public vote must be centered on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communications or well-known news outlets.

If no such public vote that meets these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a public vote without actually holding it by the stated deadline does not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will Oregon hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Oregon regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon officially carries out a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The public vote must be formally announced and executed by the Oregon state authorities.
2. The public vote must directly concern the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the public vote must be disclosed by official state communications or reputable news outlets.

The inquiry will be answered with a NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is either cancelled or delayed beyond the given date.
3. A public vote occurs, but it does not specifically address the establishment of protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry focuses solely on the occurrence of the public vote, not its outcome.

question.title: Conditional on Oregon not holding a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question considers the situation where Oregon does not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 31, 2024. In this context, we want to know if California will conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by the same date.

Resolution criteria for Oregon not holding a referendum:
- No referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
- A planned referendum is canceled or postponed beyond the specified date.
- A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Resolution criteria for California conducting a referendum:

- The referendum results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If California meets these criteria by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If not, it resolves as NO. If the condition regarding Oregon is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Oregon does not organize a referendum on abortion rights before August 2024, will California hold a referendum on abortion rights by that same date?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the scenario in which Oregon fails to organize a referendum on abortion rights prior to August 31, 2024. Within this framework, we seek to determine whether California will initiate a public referendum aimed at securing protections for abortion rights by the same deadline.

Criteria for resolving that Oregon has not organized a referendum include:

Criteria for determining if California will hold a referendum include:

- The central theme of the referendum is the protection of abortion rights.
- The outcomes of the referendum are made public through official state communications or reputable news outlets.

Should California fulfill these criteria by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered with a YES. If it does not, the answer will be NO. If the condition concerning Oregon is not satisfied, the answer will be N/A.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

para_P.title: Will the typical interest rate for a 15-year mortgage go beyond 5.5% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, at any moment in August 2024, the typical interest rate for a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as documented by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, goes beyond 5.5%. The rate must be verified by official reports from Freddie Mac or credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not surpass 5.5% at any time during August 2024, the answer will be NO. To clarify, the rate must exceed 5.5%, not simply match it.

question.title: Will Nevada maintain its $11 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Nevada remains at $11 per hour or higher. The wage must be confirmed through official Nevada state announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the wage is reduced below $11 per hour at any point by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Nevada state law.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Central Bank of Israel will declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Central Bank of Israel makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through formal communications from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official resolution made by the Monetary Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or during a press conference following a meeting. Any conjecture about potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks by individual members of the Central Bank of Israel will not be sufficient for resolution. If no such official declaration regarding an interest rate reduction is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will large protests occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are reliable reports from at least two prominent international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) regarding significant demonstrations in the UK specifically in reaction to the government's action of reducing healthcare funding. To be classified as 'significant', the demonstrations must include a minimum of 1,000 individuals in a single event or several coordinated events totaling at least 1,000 individuals throughout the UK. The demonstrations must be directly associated with the matter of healthcare funding reductions. If no such demonstrations that meet these conditions take place by the designated date, or if the funding reductions are reversed before prompting such demonstrations, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the Global Fund announcing new funding commitments over $400 million by July 2024, will the WHO declare the Zika virus outbreak over by August 2024?

Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Global Fund officially announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million through official channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. These commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions, not continuations of previous commitments.

Then, will the World Health Organization (WHO) declare the current Zika virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024? This resolves as YES if the WHO officially declares the outbreak over by that date, confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources. If no such declaration is made, or if the emergency status is extended beyond August 31, 2024, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the Global Fund reveals new funding pledges exceeding $400 million by July 2024, will the WHO announce the conclusion of the Zika virus outbreak by August 2024?
para_P.body:

These pledges should represent new projects or significant expansions, rather than extensions of earlier commitments.

Then, will the World Health Organization (WHO) declare the ongoing Zika virus outbreak to be over by August 31, 2024? This will be considered YES if the WHO officially states that the outbreak has ended by that date, as confirmed by official WHO announcements or reports from at least three trustworthy news sources. If such a declaration is not made, or if the emergency status is prolonged past August 31, 2024, it will be considered NO.

question.title: Given the Global Fund does not announce new funding commitments over $400 million by July 2024, will WHO declare the Zika outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Global Fund does not officially announce any new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 31, 2024. This includes no announcements through official Global Fund channels or reputable news sources, or announcements that do not exceed $400 million in total.

Then, is it true that the World Health Organization (WHO) will officially declare the ongoing Zika virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024? The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the Global Fund fails to announce any new funding commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024, will the WHO officially state that the Zika outbreak has ended by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Global Fund does not make any formal announcements regarding new funding commitments that surpass $400 million by July 31, 2024. This means there are no declarations via official Global Fund channels or credible news outlets, nor announcements that total more than $400 million.

Then, can it be asserted that the World Health Organization (WHO) will formally announce that the ongoing Zika virus outbreak has concluded by August 31, 2024? The confirmation of this declaration must come from official WHO communications or reports from at least three trustworthy news organizations. If such a declaration is not made by the specified date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota officially conducts a referendum regarding housing affordability. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing housing affordability. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome.

question.title: Will Tim Scott publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on criminal justice reform?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tim Scott publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on criminal justice reform. The retraction or alteration must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. If no such retraction or significant alteration is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances.

If no retraction or substantial modification is reported by the given date, the inquiry will conclude with a NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, 'publicly' refers to official statements, interviews, verified social media posts, or comments made during public appearances.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Los Angeles by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Los Angeles, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Los Angeles rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Alibaba Group come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if Alibaba Group successfully negotiates with its unionized workforce, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of workers from Alibaba Group (a minimum of 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must continue for no less than one week.
3. The resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Alibaba Group and the relevant union.
4. The resolution must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If there is no resolution that meets all these conditions by the specified date, or if no significant strike takes place, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will large protests occur in Indonesia in response to religious freedom legislation by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Indonesia specifically in response to new religious freedom legislation. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Indonesia. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of religious freedom legislation. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the legislation is rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will significant demonstrations take place in Indonesia due to new laws on religious freedom by July 2024?

To be considered 'significant', the demonstrations must consist of at least 1,000 participants in a single event or multiple coordinated events totaling at least 1,000 participants throughout Indonesia. The demonstrations must be clearly associated with the topic of religious freedom legislation. If no such demonstrations that meet these conditions occur by the given date, or if the legislation is revoked prior to inciting such demonstrations, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Spain's IBEX 35 index reach or exceed 10,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. The 10,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. If the index does not reach 10,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Sara Lee will recall its packaged meats because of a listeria outbreak before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee makes an official statement regarding the recall of any of its packaged meat items due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be validated through at least one of the following channels:

1. A formal declaration on Sara Lee's website or social media platforms
2. A press announcement from Sara Lee
3. A statement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically refers to a Sara Lee recall
4. Coverage from a minimum of three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) referencing official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no such recall that meets these conditions is announced by the specified date, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce result in more than 10 confirmed deaths by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. If the death toll remains at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only deaths directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the E. coli outbreak associated with lettuce will lead to over 10 confirmed fatalities by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are verified reports indicating more than 10 fatalities linked to the E. coli outbreak related to lettuce from a particular producer. The fatalities must be directly connected to this outbreak and should not include deaths from unrelated E. coli incidents. If the number of deaths remains at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as NO. For this question, only deaths that are directly connected to this specific outbreak will be considered.

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will a resolution be achieved between Google and the UK data protection authority by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, a formal agreement is established between Google and the UK data protection authority concerning a penalty levied on Google for purported data protection infractions. The agreement must be validated by official announcements from either side or covered by at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Bloomberg, or prominent national newspapers). The agreement should specifically pertain to the penalty imposed by the UK authority on Google. If such an agreement is not reached or publicly verified by the deadline, the answer will be NO. It is important to note that appeals, ongoing discussions, or partial agreements do not meet the criteria for a YES answer.

question.title: Will the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is the European Commission set to impose a substantial duty on solar panels produced in China by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially enacts a duty of 50% or greater on the importation of solar panels made in China. The enactment must be validated by formal announcements from the European Commission and reported by at least two prominent news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The duty must be specifically aimed at solar panels produced in China and not part of a wider duty on all imports from China or all electronic products. If such a duty that fulfills these conditions is not enacted by the given date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

para_P.title: If the European Commission does not impose a significant tariff on solar panels imported from China, will Google finalize a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Brazil's Central Bank keep the Selic rate at 13.25% or higher in August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank is documented at or exceeding 13.25% at any time during August 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or from at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is indicated to have fallen below 13.25% and stays under this threshold for the entirety of August 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: Will agricultural laborers in Argentina continue their strike until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by the end of August 2024, agricultural laborers in Argentina are still engaged in their strike or have not completely resumed normal activities following any ongoing labor conflict. The confirmation of the strike's status or the resumption of work must be provided by official declarations from agricultural organizations, the unions that represent the workers, or the government of Argentina, and must be reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have entirely returned to their duties and normal activities have been restored before or during August 2024, the answer will be NO. Any partial return to work or limited operations does not constitute a full resolution of the strike.

If it is reported that the rate has fallen below 13.25% and stays below this threshold for the entire month of August 2024, the result will be NO.

If the rate is recorded to have fallen below 13.25% and stays below this threshold for the entirety of August 2024, it is deemed a NO.

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the factory initiative of a South Korean battery manufacturer in Ohio will be called off by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is verified that the South Korean lithium-ion battery manufacturer's intention to establish a factory in Ohio has been officially terminated. Verification must be obtained from official announcements made by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or leading national newspapers). The termination must represent a complete cancellation of the project, rather than a mere postponement or alteration. If the project remains active, under consideration, or has not been formally canceled by this date, the response will be NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, 'termination' signifies that the company has officially retracted its plans or that the state has unequivocally denied the project.

question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

para_P.title: Is it possible for South Korea's KOSPI index to hit or surpass 3,500 points before August 2024?

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

para_P.title: Is Andrew Bailey going to continue his role as Governor of the Bank of England until July 2024?

question.title: Will a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be reports of a government-created AI system disseminating election misinformation by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are trustworthy reports or official alerts from election officials, government entities, or credible news organizations indicating that a government-created AI system is disseminating election misinformation. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Facebook resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Facebook workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, the United States is still enforcing a 100% tariff on the importation of machinery produced in China. question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing measles outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body:

3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets in terms of its potential effect on the Russian economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is approved but does not fulfill all the above criteria, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a major oil spill occur in the Beaufort Sea by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there is a confirmed major oil spill in the Beaufort Sea resulting from any tanker attacked by a regional militant group. A major oil spill is defined as a spill that is reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and causes significant environmental damage, requiring large-scale cleanup efforts. The spill must be directly linked to an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker in the Beaufort Sea. If no such spill occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will France's weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in France, as reported by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, exceeds 200,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies will be considered.

para_P.title: Will France experience weekly unemployment claims surpassing 200,000 for a span of three weeks continuously before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the count of weekly initial unemployment claims in France, as documented by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies, goes beyond 200,000 for three successive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. It will be considered negative if this scenario does not occur within the designated period. For the purpose of resolution, only the official statistics released by the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies will be taken into account.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if the Bank of England formally declares a reduction in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. Any conjecture about potential rate reductions or informal remarks by individual BoE members will not be considered for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry resolves as FALSE.

question.title: Will New York City announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of New York City officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within New York City's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. The record must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. question.title: Will General Motors resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:

question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years.
