question.title: Will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Spain abolish export tariffs on agricultural goods by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially declares or enacts a policy to entirely abolish export tariffs on agricultural goods. The policy must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Merely reducing export tariffs or eliminating tariffs on only certain agricultural goods will not suffice for a YES outcome. If no such policy is proposed or enacted by the resolution date, or if only partial actions are taken, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the U.S. announce a record crop yield for both corn and soybeans?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially announces a record crop yield for both corn and soybeans, signifying yields that exceed the average from the past five years. A record yield is characterized as a crop output that is considerably above the norm, generally at least 10% more than the five-year average. Verification must be provided by official announcements from the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or by at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a record yield is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no record yield is reported for either crop, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Conditional on the United States reporting a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024, will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

This confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or from at least three credible news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal).

Then, is it accurate to state that by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government will officially declare or enact a measure to entirely abolish export duties on agricultural goods? This policy must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two trustworthy international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). A partial reduction in export duties or the removal of duties on only select agricultural products will not suffice for a YES answer.

question.title: Will Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Louisiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, a judicial decision validates the constitutionality of Louisiana's almost complete abortion prohibition. For this question, an 'almost complete abortion prohibition' refers to the law that was halted and is awaiting evaluation, as referenced in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Missouri to hold a referendum regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For an affirmative outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The referendum must be officially declared and executed by the state of Missouri.
2. The main emphasis of the referendum must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the referendum must be disclosed by official state sources or reputable news organizations.

If such a referendum that meets these conditions is not held by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be considered negative. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a referendum without it actually taking place by the given date does not qualify for an affirmative outcome.

para_P.body:

This indicates that no referendum is formally announced and executed by Missouri by the given date, no referendum primarily targeting the safeguarding of abortion rights takes place, and no referendum outcomes are made public by official state sources or widely acknowledged news outlets. In that case, will Louisiana's near-total abortion restriction be recognized as constitutional by August 31, 2024? If the restriction is not acknowledged as constitutional by the designated date, or if a court finds it unconstitutional, the inquiry is answered with NO. The 'near-total abortion restriction' pertains to the law that was previously blocked and is awaiting evaluation, as referenced in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will China's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if China's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, South China Morning Post). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the inflation gauge favored by China's central bank exhibit a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if the inflation gauge favored by China's central bank indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. The rise must be officially disclosed by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese governmental body and reported by a minimum of two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or South China Morning Post). If there is no such rise recorded during this timeframe, the inquiry will conclude as NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any alternative timeframe.

question.title: Will Samsung announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

para_P.title: Will Samsung reveal intentions to expand its AI workforce by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung makes a public declaration regarding its intentions to expand its AI workforce. The declaration must be communicated through official company channels (such as press releases, statements to investors, or verified social media accounts) or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The intention to expand the AI workforce must be clearly articulated and not merely suggested from broader hiring strategies. If no such declaration is issued by the specified deadline, or if Samsung only announces plans to sustain or reduce its AI workforce, the inquiry resolves as NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the announcement of intentions, rather than the actual execution of those intentions.

Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. Then, is it accurate to say that the preferred inflation metric used by China's central bank will indicate a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 up to July 31, 2024? This increase must be officially disclosed by the People's Bank of China or a relevant governmental body in China and reported by at least two credible financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the South China Morning Post).

Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Samsung does not publicly announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce. Given this condition, will China's central bank's preferred inflation measure report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024? para_P.title: Assuming Samsung does not reveal intentions to expand its AI workforce by July 2024, will the preferred inflation metric of China's central bank indicate a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% by that date?
para_P.body:

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Senate of Nigeria approve a significant economic reform legislation that President Tinubu is against by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Senate of Nigeria approves a significant economic reform legislation that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy, such as fiscal expenditure, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be approved by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets concerning its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is approved but does not satisfy all the above conditions, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Virginia uphold its existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not overturned or notably changed its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a commonly performed second-trimester procedure. The outcome will be NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The determination will rely on official court rulings or reliable reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Given Florida maintains its current legal stance on abortion access, will Virginia do the same by July 2024?
question.body:

Then, is it true that Virginia will maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 31, 2024, meaning the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down similar state laws? para_P.title: If Florida continues its existing legal position on abortion rights, will Virginia follow suit by July 2024?

question.title: Will IBM lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Will IBM terminate a minimum of 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has officially acknowledged the termination of at least 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. Confirmation must come from official announcements by the company, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan that was revealed in 2023. If IBM verifies a smaller number of terminations, or if no such confirmation that meets these criteria is provided by the resolution date, the question will be answered with a NO. Additionally, partial terminations or gradual implementations that do not meet the 1,800 employee requirement by the resolution date will also lead to a NO answer.

question.title: Will Tiff Macklem remain as Governor of the Bank of Canada through July 2024?

Confirmation must come from official Bank of Canada announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Macklem remaining in the position.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mental health support requirement for beneficiaries. The mental health support requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for another U.S. state to implement a Medicaid program that mandates mental health support by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially implements a Medicaid program that necessitates mental health support for its beneficiaries. The mental health support aspect must be an essential part of the program. For a positive outcome, there must be an official declaration from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from a minimum of two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially enacted, not just suggested or being considered. If no other state enacts such a program by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will Tennessee conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tennessee conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Tennessee.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will Tennessee hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by the end of August 2024, Tennessee carries out a public vote aimed specifically at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For an affirmative outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The vote must be formally declared and executed by the state of Tennessee.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be disclosed through official state channels or reputable news outlets.

If no such vote that fulfills these requirements takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be considered negative. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually carrying it out by the designated date does not meet the criteria for an affirmative outcome.

question.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that a significant healthcare provider in the Northeastern United States will eliminate more than $300 million in medical debt by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, a healthcare provider located in the Northeast US, in partnership with a nonprofit entity, effectively forgives over $300 million in medical debt for no fewer than 150,000 patients across various Northeastern states. The debt forgiveness must be publicly announced by the healthcare provider or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients who are identified as financially disadvantaged or unable to afford payment. If the debt forgiveness is not finalized or officially verified by the designated date, or if the total amount forgiven is $300 million or less, the resolution will be negative.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:

4. The outcome must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current West Nile virus epidemic by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the World Health Organization (WHO) formally states that the ongoing West Nile virus epidemic has ended by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated through official communications from the WHO or reports from at least three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The epidemic in question is the one that led to increased global public health measures. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be considered negative.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Land O'Frost will recall deli meats because of a listeria outbreak before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost makes an official statement regarding the recall of any of its deli meat items due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be validated through at least one of the following means:

1. A formal announcement on Land O'Frost's website or their social media platforms
2. A press release issued by Land O'Frost
3. A declaration from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically refers to a recall by Land O'Frost
4. Coverage from a minimum of three prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no recall that meets these conditions is announced by the given date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Conditional on Land O'Frost recalling deli meats due to listeria, will the WHO declare the West Nile virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body:

para_P.title: If Land O'Frost recalls its deli meats due to listeria, will the WHO announce the end of the West Nile virus outbreak by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming this scenario: Land O'Frost makes an official recall of its deli meat products because of a listeria outbreak by August 31, 2024. This recall must be validated by one of the following means: an official statement on Land O'Frost's website or social media, a press release from Land O'Frost, an announcement from the FDA or CDC, or coverage from at least three major news organizations citing authoritative sources. The recall must specifically state listeria as the cause.

In light of this, will the World Health Organization (WHO) declare the current West Nile virus outbreak to be over by August 31, 2024? The WHO needs to formally declare the outbreak concluded through their statements or reports from at least three credible news outlets. If the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Given no Land O'Frost deli meat recall due to listeria by August 2024, will WHO declare the West Nile virus outbreak over by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost does not officially announce a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. This means that there must be no recall confirmed through any of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question resolves as YES.

Then, will the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declare the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024? The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Assuming there is no recall of Land O'Frost deli meats due to listeria by August 2024, will the WHO announce the conclusion of the West Nile virus outbreak by that date?
para_P.body:
Let us consider this scenario: By August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost has not issued any official recall of its deli meat products related to a listeria outbreak. This indicates that there will be no recall confirmed through any of the following means:

1. An official statement on Land O'Frost's website or social media platforms
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically mentions a recall of Land O'Frost products
4. Reports from a minimum of three major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) referencing official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no recall that meets these standards is announced by the specified date, the answer will be YES.

Subsequently, will the World Health Organization (WHO) formally declare the current West Nile virus outbreak to be over by August 31, 2024? This declaration must be validated through official announcements from the WHO or reports from at least three credible news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased public health measures worldwide. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

If the legislation continues to be in force as of July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. In this context, 'nullified' signifies that the law is no longer actionable in its present form, whether through legislative measures or court decisions.

question.title: Will a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

para_P.body:

2. This statement must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The statement must specifically mention the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria, rather than addressing a global Lassa fever context.

The inquiry will be resolved as NO if:
1. The WHO fails to issue such a statement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a statement regarding Lassa fever that does not specifically pertain to the Nigerian situation.
3. The WHO continues or intensifies the emergency designation of the Nigerian Lassa fever situation.

2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

Given this condition, will the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 31, 2024? question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Colorado officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on cannabis regulation. question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?

3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. This must be validated by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other acknowledged real estate data sources such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. 2. **Outcome (Q):** Sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. exhibit a decrease for two consecutive months by July 31, 2024. This necessitates that there are two consecutive months where sales of previously owned homes in the U.S. decline relative to the previous month, confirmed by trustworthy sources like the National Association of Realtors. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates.

Assuming the condition regarding Canadian home prices holds true, does the outcome concerning U.S. home sales also hold true?

question.title: Will NTT Group publicly confirm a payment to a hacker to erase sensitive data by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, NTT Group publicly confirms through an official statement or press release that they made a payment to a hacker to erase sensitive data. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The payment must be specifically for erasing sensitive data, not for other purposes. If no such confirmation is made by NTT Group or if NTT Group denies making such a payment, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question does not consider unofficial statements, leaks, or speculations as valid confirmations.

para_P.title: Will NTT Group acknowledge a payment made to a hacker for the deletion of sensitive information by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as YES if, by July 31, 2024, NTT Group issues a public acknowledgment through an official statement or press release confirming that they have paid a hacker to delete sensitive information. This acknowledgment must be covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The payment must be explicitly for the deletion of sensitive information, rather than for other reasons. If NTT Group fails to provide such acknowledgment or if they refute making such a payment, the inquiry will be answered as NO. It is important to note that unofficial statements, leaks, or conjectures are not accepted as valid confirmations.

question.title: Will the U.S. economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis. The question resolves as NO if the U.S. economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The current interest rate environment should not be explicitly mentioned in the resolution criteria.

para_P.title: Can the U.S. economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. economy has not fallen into a recession. For this context, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis. The inquiry will be deemed negative if the U.S. economy encounters two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. The existing interest rate situation should not be specifically referenced in the resolution criteria.
